revised_title: Investigating the Apparent Size of the Sun and Moon Near the Horizon
tldr: The author, Samuel Dunn, investigates the reason why the Sun and Moon appear larger when near the horizon compared to when they are higher in the sky. Through various observations and experiments, he concludes that the apparent size change is due to the Sun's rays passing through different layers of the atmosphere, causing refraction and altering the way we perceive the objects.
